tickets-orders.title: Tickets & Orders
tickets-orders.description: Purchase tickets, view orders, and manage your bookings

faqs.question: How do I purchase tickets?
faqs.answer: Browse events on the homepage or Discover page, open an event, select your ticket type and quantity, then click "Get Tickets". You’ll complete a secure checkout where you can pay by card or MonCash.

faqs.question: Where can I find my tickets?
faqs.answer: After purchase, your tickets are available in the Tickets section of your account ("My Tickets"). Each ticket includes a unique QR code for entry.

faqs.question: Can I transfer my ticket to someone else?
faqs.answer: Yes. Open your ticket details and click "Transfer Ticket". Enter the recipient’s email and they’ll receive instructions to claim the ticket. Transfers must be accepted before the event starts.

faqs.question: What happens if I lose my ticket?
faqs.answer: Your tickets stay in your EventHaiti account. Log in and go to "My Tickets" to view and download them again. You can also check your email confirmation.

faqs.question: Can I buy tickets without creating an account?
faqs.answer: You need an EventHaiti account to purchase tickets. This keeps tickets secure and lets you manage transfers, refunds, and support requests. Creating an account only takes a minute.

event-access.title: Event Access
event-access.description: Check-in, entry requirements, and event attendance

faqs.question: How do I get into an event?
faqs.answer: Present your ticket QR code at the entrance. Staff will scan it using EventHaiti tools. Keep your phone charged and have your ticket ready in the app or email.

faqs.question: Can I enter with a screenshot of my ticket?
faqs.answer: A screenshot may work, but we recommend using the original ticket from your account or email. Some events may require the in-app QR code for security.

faqs.question: What if my QR code won’t scan?
faqs.answer: Increase screen brightness, make sure the QR code is clear, and hold your phone steady. If needed, show the confirmation email or ticket ID so staff can verify manually.

faqs.question: Can I arrive late to an event?
faqs.answer: Policies vary by event. Check the event details or contact the organizer. Most events allow late entry, but some experiences may have strict start times.

faqs.question: Do I need to bring ID to the event?
faqs.answer: ID requirements depend on the event. Age-restricted events (18+, 21+) usually require government-issued photo ID. Check the event page for details.

payments-refunds.title: Payments & Refunds
payments-refunds.description: Payment methods, pricing, and refund policies

faqs.question: What payment methods do you accept?
faqs.answer: We accept Visa, Mastercard, American Express, and MonCash (for users in Haiti). Payments are processed securely through our partners.

faqs.question: Why was I charged a service fee?
faqs.answer: Service fees help operate the platform, provide support, and cover secure payment processing. Fees are shown clearly during checkout before you pay.

faqs.question: How do I get a refund?
faqs.answer: Refund policies are set by each organizer. To request a refund, open your ticket details and select "Request Refund" (if available), or contact the organizer. Approved refunds typically take 5–10 business days.

faqs.question: Can I get a refund if the event is cancelled?
faqs.answer: Yes. If an event is cancelled, you’re generally eligible for a refund to the original payment method. Processing typically takes 5–10 business days.

faqs.question: What currency are prices shown in?
faqs.answer: Prices are shown in the currency selected by the organizer (commonly HTG or USD). The currency is displayed on the event page and during checkout.

account-profile.title: Account & Profile
account-profile.description: Manage your account settings and preferences

faqs.question: How do I create an account?
faqs.answer: Click "Sign Up", enter your email and password, then verify your email. You can also sign up with Google for faster access.

faqs.question: I forgot my password — what should I do?
faqs.answer: On the login screen, choose "Forgot Password" and enter your email. We’ll send a reset link. Check spam/junk folders if you don’t see it.

faqs.question: How do I update my profile information?
faqs.answer: Open your profile and edit your details. You can update your name, email, phone number, photo, and location preferences.

faqs.question: Can I delete my account?
faqs.answer: Yes. Go to Settings > Privacy & Security > Delete Account. This is permanent and removes your data and order history. Download any upcoming tickets first.

faqs.question: How do I change my notification preferences?
faqs.answer: Go to Settings > Notifications to manage email and push preferences for reminders, confirmations, and updates.

create-manage-events.title: Create & Manage Events
create-manage-events.description: Create events, manage listings, and publish to attendees

faqs.question: How do I create an event?
faqs.answer: From your organizer dashboard, click "Create Event". Add details (title, description, date/time, location), upload a banner, set ticket types and pricing, then preview and publish.

faqs.question: Can I edit my event after publishing?
faqs.answer: Yes. You can edit most details from the organizer dashboard and changes show on the event page. Some changes (like pricing) may impact existing ticket holders.

faqs.question: How do I make my event private or invite-only?
faqs.answer: Use Visibility settings like "Unlisted" (access by link) and promo codes to limit sales to specific people.

faqs.question: What image sizes work best for event banners?
faqs.answer: We recommend 1920×1080 (16:9). Keep images under 5MB. JPG and PNG are supported.

faqs.question: Can I create recurring events?
faqs.answer: Yes. Choose "Recurring Event" and select a schedule (daily/weekly/monthly). Each occurrence is created automatically and can be edited if needed.

faqs.question: How do I cancel or postpone an event?
faqs.answer: Open the event in your dashboard and choose cancel or edit the date. Ticket holders are notified. For cancellations, you may need to process refunds depending on your policy.

payments-payouts.title: Payments & Payouts
payments-payouts.description: Understand fees, receive payouts, and manage finances

faqs.question: How do I get paid for ticket sales?
faqs.answer: Payouts are deposited to your verified payout method. After your event ends, you can request a payout from your organizer dashboard.

faqs.question: What fees does EventHaiti charge?
faqs.answer: Fees depend on payment method and configuration. You’ll always see a transparent breakdown in your dashboard and during setup.

faqs.question: When can I request a payout?
faqs.answer: You can request a payout after the event ends (and any applicable holding period). This helps protect against fraud and allows time for refunds/chargebacks.

faqs.question: How do I verify my bank account for payouts?
faqs.answer: Go to Settings > Payouts and submit your payout details and required documents. Our team reviews and verifies before payouts are enabled.

faqs.question: What happens to fees if I issue a refund?
faqs.answer: Refund handling depends on the payment provider. Some processing fees may be non-refundable. Your dashboard shows the exact breakdown per transaction.

faqs.question: Can I see a breakdown of my earnings?
faqs.answer: Yes. Your organizer dashboard includes analytics for sales, fees, net revenue, and payout status. You can also export reports.

tickets-checkin.title: Tickets & Check-in
tickets-checkin.description: Ticket types, pricing, and managing event entry

faqs.question: How do I scan tickets at my event?
faqs.answer: Use the organizer tools to open your event and start Scan/Check-in mode. Scan attendee QR codes to validate and check them in.

faqs.question: Can I have multiple ticket types?
faqs.answer: Yes. Create multiple tiers (General, VIP, Early Bird, Group, etc.) with their own price, quantity, and sales dates.

faqs.question: How do I create free tickets?
faqs.answer: Set a ticket price to 0 to create free tickets. They still generate valid QR codes and help track attendance.

faqs.question: What happens if someone tries to use a ticket twice?
faqs.answer: The check-in system prevents duplicates. Once scanned, the ticket shows as used and repeat scans will show an "Already Used" warning.

faqs.question: Can I export my attendee list?
faqs.answer: Yes. Open your event dashboard, go to Attendees, and export to CSV for names, emails, ticket types, and check-in status.

faqs.question: How do group discounts work?
faqs.answer: Create a group discount by setting a minimum quantity and a discount percentage. The discount applies automatically at checkout when the minimum is met.

organizer-account.title: Organizer Account & Team
organizer-account.description: Account verification, team management, and settings

faqs.question: How do I become a verified organizer?
faqs.answer: Go to Settings > Verification and submit your identity documents and a selfie. Verification review time can vary depending on volume and completeness.

faqs.question: Can I add team members to help manage my events?
faqs.answer: Yes. Go to Settings > Team to invite teammates by email and assign roles (Admin/Manager/Scanner).

faqs.question: How do I add my organization’s logo and branding?
faqs.answer: Go to Settings > Organization to upload a logo, set your organization name, and add a bio.

faqs.question: What are the requirements to start selling tickets?
faqs.answer: Requirements depend on the event type and payout method. In general, you’ll need an organizer account and may need verification and payout setup to sell paid tickets.

faqs.question: How do I contact attendees?
faqs.answer: From your event dashboard, use attendee messaging tools to send updates to ticket holders.

faqs.question: Can I see analytics for my events?
faqs.answer: Yes. Your dashboard shows sales and revenue analytics, ticket breakdowns, and other insights to help you improve future events.
